statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Sam Houston St. 63, Stephen F. Austin 57
article.headline: Sam Houston St. 63, Stephen F. Austin 57
article.linkText: Sam Houston St. 63, Stephen F. Austin 57
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas (AP) -- Chris Jordan and Ryan Bright each scored 14 points as Sam Houston State beat Stephen F. Austin 63-57 Saturday night. Sam Houston State (8-6, 2-1 Southland Conference) led by as much as 12 points in the second half but saw Stephen F. Austin (7-7, 1-2) close the gap late. Marcus Clark, who converted all 11 of his free throws, led the Lumberjacks with 23 points and Anthony Paez added 16. Bright hit a pair of free throws to put Sam Houston State ahead 53-41 with six minutes left. Stephen F. Austin cut the deficit to five points with 2:30 left but could get no closer the rest of the way. The Bearkats shot 56 percent (20-of-36) from the field while the Lumberjacks struggled by shooting 35 percent (18-of-51). Stephen F. Austin led 23-19 late in the first half, but Sam Houston State rallied to take a 26-25 halftime lead. The Bearkats did not trail in the second half.
